com.ab.utilities

Class ExcelUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ab.utilities.ExcelUtil

  • public final class ExcelUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    The ExcelUtil class provides methods to read data from an Excel file. It contains a public method to get test data from the specified sheet in the Excel file.

    Note: The class has a private constructor to prevent instantiation of the class. It uses the FrameworkConstants class to get the path of the Excel file. It uses the ExcelFileNotFoundException and ExcelReadException classes to throw custom exceptions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getTestData(java.lang.String sheetName)
      This method reads the test data from the specified sheet in the Excel file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getTestData

        public static java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getTestData(java.lang.String sheetName)
        This method reads the test data from the specified sheet in the Excel file. It returns the test data as a List of Maps, where each Map represents a row in the Excel sheet and the keys represent the column headers.

        Note: The first row of the Excel sheet is considered as the header row.

        Parameters:
        sheetName - The name of the sheet from which the test data is to be read
        Returns:
        The test data as a List of Maps
        Throws:
        ExcelFileNotFoundException - If the Excel file is not found at the path specified in the FrameworkConstants class
        ExcelReadException - If an exception occurs while reading the Excel file
